slots.question: You're 13 days out from Chicago with no backpacking destination booked — the warm weekend trip is March 14-15. You also need to lock down flights and REI gear rentals.
slots.answer: Southern Utah (Zion/Capitol Reef) is 60-70°F mid-March, Texas has Big Bend at similar temps, or Joshua Tree in California hits 75°F. REI rents complete backpacking kits for ~$50-70/weekend — you can reserve online and pick up at Chicago Lincoln Park or Northbrook stores.

slots.question: You have 4 nights in Kyoto starting March 25 but no plan for what to do. Dana's turning 30 on this trip — Kyoto is the perfect place to make that memorable.
slots.answer: Fushimi Inari has 10,000 vermillion torii gates you walk through — no reservation needed, best at sunrise or sunset. Arashiyama bamboo grove opens at 8am (go early to avoid crowds). Kinkaku-ji (Golden Pavilion) is the iconic photo spot, and Philosopher's Path is a 2km canal walk connecting temples.

slots.question: You want sibling gifts from Japan — fountain pens in the ~$100 range that you can't easily get in the US.
slots.answer: Pilot Custom Heritage 92 runs ¥11,000 (~$110) in Japan vs $180 in the US — transparent demonstrator with piston fill. Sailor Pro Gear Slim is ¥13,000 (~$130) in Japan. Tokyo's Itoya Ginza has 12 floors of stationery and is the best one-stop shop.
